00041 #define _BSD_SOURCE
00042 
00043 #include <stdio.h>
00044 #include <stdlib.h>
00045 #include <unistd.h>
00046 #include <getopt.h>
00047 #include <string.h>
00048 #include <sys/types.h>
00049 #include <sys/stat.h>
00050 #include <fcntl.h>
00051 #include <sys/queue.h>
00052 #include <signal.h>
00053 #include <errno.h>
00054 #include <dirent.h>
00055 #include <sys/uio.h>
00056 #include <sys/time.h>
00057 #include <stdarg.h>
00058 
00059 static char lustre_path[] = "/mnt/lustre";
00060 
00061 #define ENTRY(str)                                                      \
00062         do {                                                            \
00063                 char buf[100];                                          \
00064                 int len;                                                \
00065                 sprintf(buf, "===== START %s: %s ", __FUNCTION__, (str)); \
00066                 len = strlen(buf);                                      \
00067                 if (len < 79) {                                         \
00068                         memset(buf+len, '=', 100-len);                  \
00069                         buf[79] = '\n';                                 \
00070                         buf[80] = 0;                                    \
00071                 }                                                       \
00072                 printf("%s", buf);                                      \
00073         } while (0)
00074 
00075 #define LEAVE()                                                         \
00076         do {                                                            \
00077                 char buf[100];                                          \
00078                 int len;                                                \
00079                 sprintf(buf, "===== END TEST %s: successfully ",        \
00080                         __FUNCTION__);                                  \
00081                 len = strlen(buf);                                      \
00082                 if (len < 79) {                                         \
00083                         memset(buf+len, '=', 100-len);                  \
00084                         buf[79] = '\n';                                 \
00085                         buf[80] = 0;                                    \
00086                 }                                                       \
00087                 printf("%s", buf);                                      \
00088         } while (0)
00089 
00090 #define EXIT return
00091 
00092 #define MAX_PATH_LENGTH 4096
00093 
00094 
00095 int t_fcntl(int fd, int cmd, ...)
00096 {
00097         va_list ap;
00098         long arg;
00099         struct flock *lock;
00100         int rc = -1;
00101 
00102         va_start(ap, cmd);
00103         switch (cmd) {
00104         case F_GETFL:
00105                 va_end(ap);
00106                 rc = fcntl(fd, cmd);
00107                 if (rc == -1) {
00108                         printf("fcntl GETFL failed: %s\n",
00109                                  strerror(errno));
00110                         EXIT(1);
00111                 }
00112                 break;
00113         case F_SETFL:
00114                 arg = va_arg(ap, long);
00115                 va_end(ap);
00116                 rc = fcntl(fd, cmd, arg);
00117                 if (rc == -1) {
00118                         printf("fcntl SETFL %ld failed: %s\n",
00119                                  arg, strerror(errno));
00120                         EXIT(1);
00121                 }
00122                 break;
00123         case F_GETLK:
00124         case F_SETLK:
00125         case F_SETLKW:
00126                 lock = va_arg(ap, struct flock *);
00127                 va_end(ap);
00128                 rc = fcntl(fd, cmd, lock);
00129                 if (rc == -1) {
00130                         printf("fcntl cmd %d failed: %s\n",
00131                                  cmd, strerror(errno));
00132                         EXIT(1);
00133                 }
00134                 break;
00135         case F_DUPFD:
00136                 arg = va_arg(ap, long);
00137                 va_end(ap);
00138                 rc = fcntl(fd, cmd, arg);
00139                 if (rc == -1) {
00140                         printf("fcntl F_DUPFD %d failed: %s\n",
00141                                  (int)arg, strerror(errno));
00142                         EXIT(1);
00143                 }
00144                 break;
00145         default:
00146                 va_end(ap);
00147                 printf("fcntl cmd %d not supported\n", cmd);
00148                 EXIT(1);
00149         }
00150         printf("fcntl %d = %d, ltype = %d\n", cmd, rc, lock->l_type);
00151         return rc;
00152 }
00153 
00154 int t_unlink(const char *path)
00155 {
00156         int rc;
00157 
00158         rc = unlink(path);
00159         if (rc) {
00160                 printf("unlink(%s) error: %s\n", path, strerror(errno));
00161                 EXIT(-1);
00162         }
00163         return rc;
00164 }
00165 
00166 void t21()
00167 {
00168         char file[MAX_PATH_LENGTH] = "";
00169         int fd, ret;
00170         struct flock lock = {
00171                 .l_type = F_RDLCK,
00172                 .l_whence = SEEK_SET,
00173         };
00174 
00175         ENTRY("basic fcntl support");
00176         snprintf(file, MAX_PATH_LENGTH, "%s/test_t21_file", lustre_path);
00177 
00178         fd = open(file, O_RDWR|O_CREAT, (mode_t)0666);
00179         if (fd < 0) {
00180                 printf("open(%s) error: %s\n", file, strerror(errno));
00181                 exit(-1);
00182         }
00183 
00184         t_fcntl(fd, F_SETFL, O_APPEND);
00185         if (!(ret = t_fcntl(fd, F_GETFL)) & O_APPEND) {
00186                 printf("error get flag: ret %x\n", ret);
00187                 exit(-1);
00188         }
00189 
00190         t_fcntl(fd, F_SETLK, &lock);
00191         t_fcntl(fd, F_GETLK, &lock);
00192         lock.l_type = F_WRLCK;
00193         t_fcntl(fd, F_SETLKW, &lock);
00194         t_fcntl(fd, F_GETLK, &lock);
00195         lock.l_type = F_UNLCK;
00196         t_fcntl(fd, F_SETLK, &lock);
00197 
00198         close(fd);
00199         t_unlink(file);
00200         LEAVE();
00201 }
00202 
00203 
00204 int main(int argc, char * const argv[])
00205 {
00206         /* Set D_VFSTRACE to see messages from ll_file_flock.
00207            The test passes either with -o flock or -o noflock 
00208            mount -o flock -t lustre uml1:/mds1/client /mnt/lustre */
00209         t21();
00210 
00211         printf("completed successfully\n");
00212         return 0;
00213 }
